name: ScrapydWeb app (git repo, unstable)
description: How to set up Scrapyd cluster on Heroku

SCRAPYD_SERVER_1.description: You can add more Scrapyd servers in the web UI of Heroku after the app is bulit, and the key of the environment variable should be like SCRAPYD_SERVER_n (n for a unique integer).

SCRAPYD_SERVER_2.description: See SCRAPYD_SERVER_1, type del to ignore the environment variable

SCRAPYD_SERVER_3.description: See SCRAPYD_SERVER_1, type del to ignore the environment variable

SCRAPYD_SERVER_4.description: See SCRAPYD_SERVER_1, type del to ignore the environment variable

ENABLE_AUTH.description: The default is False, set it to True to enable basic auth for web UI.

USERNAME.description: In order to enable basic auth, both USERNAME and PASSWORD should be non-empty strings.

PASSWORD.description: In order to enable basic auth, both USERNAME and PASSWORD should be non-empty strings.

TZ.description: Timezone of the app, get it via: python -c "import tzlocal; print(tzlocal.get_localzone())"

VERBOSE.description: The default is False, set it to True to change the logging level from WARNING to DEBUG.
